website_summaries.verdict: Paint brand that's manufactured especially to maintain integrity in high temperature situations.
pros: Will withstand temperatures up to 550 degrees Fahrenheit, making it one of the best heat resistant paints available among engine enamels
Offered in multiple colors that match factory specs
Made to resist corrosion, rust, salt spray, and additives to gasoline
cons: Spray paint can is a little smaller than some others, so its cost per ounce is higher than average

customer_reviews.title: Great, even applying paint
customer_reviews.text: Bought VHT Satin Black & Gold paints for our motor. Both applied very well and came out looking great. I did use Rustoleum 2000 degree primer before applying these paints to the motor. I also used the gold paint on the brake calipers and covered with rustoleum 2000 degree clear coat. DO NOT USE VHT Caliper Paint. It was terrible....but this Engine paint is great!
customer_reviews.author: Double A

customer_reviews.title: No good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: If it is your first time painting with spraycan just keep away and get something else, no instructions whatsoever and it does not spray, paint comes out like a jet wash, it feels like brake cleaner or similar stuff where you need pressure to penetrate and clean the surface, it should spray like powder, this does make the job a lot more difficult and you need to make sure to cover much larger area to not over spray everything under your car, dont understand why they could not make it like their prime but the paint is CRAP.
customer_reviews.author: kamran pedrampour

customer_reviews.title: Used on the engine. Works really well and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Used on the engine. Works really well and it has stayed put for 4 months at least (everyday driving in a turbo vehicle, seen extreme temps).
customer_reviews.author: Ivy

customer_reviews.title: Good coverage and proper color for my circa 1960s Chrysler ...
customer_reviews.text: Good coverage and proper color for my circa 1960s Chrysler engine (after I tried Valspar Plasticoat Chrysler Blue which had inferior coverage and the WRONG COLOR! I will be purchasing more of these now that I know for sure it's right. One can painted the intake, the valve covers, water pump housing, thermostat housing, etc.
customer_reviews.author: G. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Four tones darker
customer_reviews.text: It is not as pictured or the same color. This is a green yes, just not the same color on the cap or as pictured. More of a darker green. If your looking for a lime, electric, atomic green. This Is NOT it. This is at least four to five tones darker that the cap. The pic shown just be prepared and add dour tones darker. Other than that the paint goes on well. Just now cannot use for my application as it would throw off everything and the tone, theme of my build
customer_reviews.author: Sinner

customer_reviews.title: shake first
customer_reviews.text: I don't imagine too many calls for Chrysler Hemi Orange, Engine Paint. To get it to the right color, because the paint solids had settled, I had to shake vigorosely, turn upside down and shake some more. After that I allowed it to sit upside down for several hours then shook vigurosly again. the proper orange color came out finally. I should have put on and engine primer, like an epoxy primer, then painted over that. But the engine is painted and looks ok.
customer_reviews.author: Richard R. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Vht is the best around!
customer_reviews.text: VHT paint is great as always what can I say? Used this to prime the aluminum block on a predator 212 bike engine and it came out great. I wasn’t expecting it to have the ceramic? flake in it but in the end it came out nicely with the VHT black oxide case paint over it. Good, durable gas/oil resistant stuff as long as you prep the surface well and bake it after curing.
customer_reviews.author: Bikelife570

customer_reviews.title: Color and sprayer wrong...wrong...wrong!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The first can I used spit all over the place and would continue to do so after I stopped using it preceding to spray on my arms. the wall, etc. The second issue is the color and finish. Gloss? Nope. And, after 5 coats (see pic) it's still grey. I am also unsure of why I am getting a pebble finish on sanded, smooth and cleaned metal. Very strange. I took a can of Krylon Maxx and it was immediately black and glossy. Now I only have to hope the Krylon doesn't blister from the heat.
customer_reviews.author: DWM

customer_reviews.title: Old brand ,Still the good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I painted three different parts on my brand new motor 2. Yes ago. The VHT was on the block and heads . The valve covers (aluminum) we’re done in duplicolor they have peeled and the intake manifold was also duplicolor clear. Is now yellowed realy bad. I believe duplicolor owns VHT now. Just stick to VHT engine ENAMEL .for a higher gloss they have engine enamel clear.
customer_reviews.author: steven j.

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to spray on smoothly and consistently
customer_reviews.text: I haven't yet run the engine with the painted parts, but the application was easy and the results look awesome. I've used other paints that require a proper technique to come out nice but this VHT was easy to use. The satin finish is very nice. Just what you'd expect from the name - not matte, not glossy.
customer_reviews.author: XpertskiR

customer_reviews.title: Durable high temp clear finish
customer_reviews.text: Clear coated my Subaru valve covers, baked the coats on between and it came out crystal clear. Small bubbled in the corners at first but they disapated when I baked the finish.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works good on everything!
customer_reviews.text: Tried it on a oil pan I had layin round and then Decided to do a little color matching, sence everything was faded it works great on interior, used 300 grit paper. wish woulda painted everything inside. Stuff works great goes on smooth and don't get runny, just follow the directions on the can sand, prime and paint and it comes out nearly perfec for rattle cannin! Only 4 stars cause ORILLY'S sells it for 10$! But will be using this product again in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Goat

customer_reviews.title: Has a nice easy touch nozzle from the old days!
customer_reviews.text: PROS: 1) Has a nice easy touch nozzle from the old days! With this type of nozzle, spray paint can be more easily applied versus using the usual spray paint can nozzles. 2) Excellent quick dry time for manipulating the item around for complete painting within approximately one hour. (10-15 minutes before the item can be handled or manipulated.) 3) Made in the US (Cleveland, Ohio) CONS: Takes several light coats to coat, then instructions specify top off with one thick coat.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: "Red" is not red.
customer_reviews.text: This paint is heavy and has a nice gloss to it. I'm sure that it will hold up well but be warned the color of the paint doesn't match the cap very well. It's not a big deal for me because this is going on a 26 year old truck but I might be disappointed if I was restoring a nice vehicle. Still worth five stars to me but I thought you might want to know.
customer_reviews.author: B. Testin

customer_reviews.title: Never could get a good spray pattern
customer_reviews.text: I have used spray paints for many years and this is the worst one ever. No matter how much I shook the can to mix it, the first split second would be big globs of paint, followed by about a 6-12 inch streak of good spray pattern, followed by only the solvent coming out of the can. Shake again for a minute, or more, same issue. I tried an old trick of putting the can in warm(not hot) water for a better spray pattern, no improvement. A waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Gavin Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Color Formulation Has Changed
customer_reviews.text: Although this appears to be the same great product it has always been, the color formulation has changed over the years and it no longer matches the original Ford engine color. If you are painting an entire engine it might not be so noticeable, but individual engine parts will show up as a different color. This new color formulation shades a little more toward a purple color.
customer_reviews.author: Pops

customer_reviews.title: Hot garbage....do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Been a professional painter for 2 decades, I prepped perfectly. This garbage paint sprays spots and flakes all over the surface and sags even with very light coats. Immediately threw it in the trash. Waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.author: EnduringArts

customer_reviews.title: Peppa Pig
customer_reviews.text: This is not Hot Pink, it’s more like Peppa Pig Pink.
customer_reviews.author: NoneYaBiznaz

customer_reviews.title: ok buy.
customer_reviews.text: The color on the lid is Not the color that comes out. It's more of a pastel "baby pink" then a "hot pink". Seems to hold up to the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine Angel

customer_reviews.title: From green to white.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Used it to paint my oven door. From avocado green to glossy white. Easy to use, with several light coats. Looks really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Shoam

customer_reviews.title: Their claims of chemical resistance is a lie
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst product ever they claim its resistant to todays petroleum products but one drop of fuel and my paint was ruined i sprayed 5 coats of this garbage on their what a complete waste of money now ive got to sand everything re-prime it and repaint it all theirs 300$ dwn the toilet
customer_reviews.author: Heidi H.

customer_reviews.title: It worked for me
customer_reviews.text: It worked quite well for resurfacing a cast iron pot lid which had a colored exterior coated with glass. The glass coat had come off it the dishwasher. This gloss spray restored most of the shine - not all - but I am grateful for what I got because I was devastated over what the dishwasher did to my beautiful and rather pricey pot. it is oven worthy again.
customer_reviews.author: Lindy

customer_reviews.title: I got a bad batch.
customer_reviews.text: They sprayed out more like a fine mist of powder than paint. I had go and buy more locally to get the job done. RETURNED.
customer_reviews.author: Wrecho

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased VHT sp148, sp183, and sp184 to paint the rims of my car flat black. I was a little bit hesitant because I didn't see as many reviews for VHT, which is why I'm writing this review- they came out great A couple hours and about 2 cans of each mentioned, and my rims came out just like I wanted. I have no experience with spray paint, but it was really easy to get a nice even shade. It's been about 2 months so far and I haven't noticed any chipping after all of the ice, mud, salt, and snow we've had. So, If you're thinking about painting your rims black I would definitely recommend the products I mentioned
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Pretty close to Nissan Blue
customer_reviews.text: I used this to paint my engine block in my Datsun 510. Since i wanted to keep it relatively original-looking, i wanted a color to match the Nissan Blue color that they used in all the stock engines. While a bit lighter, this Blue is very close, and close enough for restoration projects and my purposes. As an enamel, it has still held up, 2 years and several hundred heat cycles later.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Dockery

customer_reviews.title: Poor spray quality... hard to use!
customer_reviews.text: This spray paint can was a mess! Spitting, and spurting... droplets of paint all over... used rustoleum on same project sprays like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: Katy

customer_reviews.title: Color did not stay consistent
customer_reviews.text: I used this paint on my calipers I did not like the fact that 3 different colors would come out. It would spray white, light pink and dark pink. The color did not stay consistent. It was really hard to get all the calipers the same color
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This product is terrible and cannot be refunded if needed.
customer_reviews.text: This product is 100% unusable. The first of 2 cans I ordered had leaked out an odd goo that looked like dry varnish rendering the can unusable. The second can did allow me to get paint out but the spray pattern was just gobs and chunks similar to popcorn ceiling texture. BTW I did follow the directions on the can while failing to get use out of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its good spray paint when it come out of the can
customer_reviews.text: Its good spray paint when it come out of the can. It would clog up after 10 seconds of spraying then you would have to spray it away from your project so you don't get clumps of paint on what you are spaying. When that happened I let it dry and wet sanded it with 600 wet and dry sandpaper and then continued with the top coats also VHT paint no problems with the Red and Clear Just the Primer. It set me back about 2 Hours all together.
customer_reviews.author: paul e ulmer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Used to paint fuse box cover inside engine compartment. Sprayed over adhesion spray base. Still looking good
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: not as good as others
customer_reviews.text: paint colors not consistent, spray is uneven and begins to "spit" as the can nears half empty
customer_reviews.author: PapaSam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to paint the intake on my hot rod. Worked flawlessly! Yup, intake on my Honda mower! Paint laid down perfect and after baking it, per the instructions, it turned out perfect.
customer_reviews.author: T.Lekas

customer_reviews.title: Great look
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used VHTs products was about a month ago. The paint seems to be very durable, time will tell. Application was easy and the paint laid down smooth. The hot pink paint is true to its color and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Crocker

customer_reviews.title: Bright Red = Watermellon ?
customer_reviews.text: came out as kind of a water melon color, ...not the bright red of the pic or the can cap. ran out of paint just before the end of the 2nd coat, ...have primer left though, and did 2 coats of that also. I used the so called "bright red" over the VHT SP307 High Performance Self-Etch Primer, which in reality is in a green cap can and not the gold cap can that Amazon pictures. (and has been called out repeatedly but they don't change the pic). that comes out green just like the can cap though.
customer_reviews.author: french knight

customer_reviews.title: It is what they advertise, superb
customer_reviews.text: I had difficulty with one can, came out white speckled....but second can worked well. color is correct, delivery was fast
customer_reviews.author: Torsten

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: VHT has always been my top choice for high heat paint. I've been using it on engines and headers since the 70's. This latest version is still great!
customer_reviews.author: tommytrekr

customer_reviews.title: A-OKAY
customer_reviews.text: I am quite pleased with this item! I would gladly recommend this seller & product to others.
customer_reviews.author: Parlous1

customer_reviews.title: cleans up an old motor
customer_reviews.text: covered well and stands up to the temp of my marine motor.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie J. Troyer

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend !!!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed for the price. Poor spray tip and low pressure,sprays straight pattern instead of a fan which results in a poor finish. One can was more than enough for my project but it only covered 3/4 of my project. Purchased another brand (same color) for 1/2 the price and was able to get approximately 2+ coats to finally get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sprays horribly
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this. It stays out contaminants and makes spots all over. Horrible. Buy the other popular brand. Works much better. This will ruin all of your prep.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stuff works an comes out looking great
customer_reviews.text: follow instructions an watch a few videos for best outcome, fast shipping also
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: You know this brand
customer_reviews.text: One of the top brands of high heat paint. It’s colorfast and high quality.
customer_reviews.author: David Harris

customer_reviews.title: What garbage. Copious shaking did not improve the god-awful gloopy ...
customer_reviews.text: Holy moly! What garbage. Copious shaking did not improve the god-awful gloopy spray pattern. Beware!! At this cost I would at least expect it to apply like a $3 can of paint, but nope, way worse. Please look elsewhere for your hi-temp rattle can needs.
customer_reviews.author: M. Reller

customer_reviews.title: Not the look I expected
customer_reviews.text: I have used vht paint before and I think it's great paint. For some reason this paint did not lay down right and I ended up with a dry orange peel splatter look.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonir Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Great primer. My little engine looks nice and stands up to the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin N.

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: No issues. Works as advertised. Good quality and sprayer (goes on easy and as expected).
customer_reviews.author: Dan V.

customer_reviews.title: Pontiac Blue
customer_reviews.text: The color is very nice, looks like original Pontiac blue. I sprayed a little bit to test it, it’s a little thinner than expected so make sure you start off far away so you don’t get any drips. Excited to use this on my 6.0 LS swap.
customer_reviews.author: K. Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Has a hint of blue...
customer_reviews.text: Nice color and has been holding up fine but has a hint of blue, more than i was looking for. I actually wanted silver but it looks ok...
customer_reviews.author: B.Mazda

customer_reviews.title: Great spray paint
customer_reviews.text: The spray paint has a continuous and even spray patter. Perfect for detailed projects.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C. Baines Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Old paint
customer_reviews.text: The paint was old. Would not spray out of the can. It spit the paint out then clogged the tip.
customer_reviews.author: Stewy

customer_reviews.title: One of the best paints
customer_reviews.text: Great paint heated my Forks on my Harley first time I've ever done it and it worked out great looks like a professional paid would definitely recommend this pain again just wish it was a little cheaper
customer_reviews.author: jack

customer_reviews.title: ... for my wheels the first can lay down really good the next two cans were spitting and coming out ...
customer_reviews.text: About four cans of primer for my wheels the first can lay down really good the next two cans were spitting and coming out dry The finish look was like sandpaper it wasn’t my prep work because the wheels were sanded I had to resand The rims Buy new primer at the auto shop which is not cheap these cans must’ve been old and I wasn’t for the lack of shaking the can one pissed off customer
customer_reviews.author: John Trautmann

customer_reviews.title: A better can exists.
customer_reviews.text: Great paint in a cheap can. I only got about a quarter of the paint out before the spray nozzle broke. It stopped spraying and then just dribbled.
customer_reviews.author: Donald R. Purifoy

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: It wouldn’t spray. It push out two little grey pieces of paint and that’s it. Looked like two pieces of grey rice. This wasn’t stored properly at all! Now, I have a useless can.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Goes on great, just used the primer on my for motorcycle rims (took my time, 2 lighter sprays with 10 minutes breaks and then a 3rd full spray) and the coverage was great! (I used a lazy Susan) can’t wait for the next step, Grabber Lime Green!!
customer_reviews.author: chris hoernlein

customer_reviews.title: Great quality paint and I have been user of vht ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed this particular color for a cancer tribute project I was working on. Great quality paint and I have been user of vht engine paints for about four years now. Nothing really covers quite as good or holds up to the extreme temps that my engines run at as well.
customer_reviews.author: Izoro electrcal systems Inc

customer_reviews.title: Real nice wrinkle
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a valve cover on a 2.4 Ecotec in my Slingshot. And of course I wanted it to turn out perfectly. And it did. I baked it in the convection oven at 200 degrees for about 1 1/2 hours, and it looks great. I had a couple of runs in it after spraying it but when on the engine you have to look really hard to see them.
customer_reviews.author: steve Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Superior Quality
customer_reviews.text: REALLY HIGH QUALITY! My husband surprised me and painted the brush guard and taillight covers on my Hummer H2 in this color. It's gorgeous!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah&Mike

customer_reviews.title: And worst of all I cannot return this
customer_reviews.text: Defective product, after spending considerable time and effort doing the proper prep on the parts the primer started spitting and sputtering dripping all over ruining the finish. And worst of all I cannot return this. Don't buy these on Amazon at least if you but them at your local auto parts store and have a problem you can get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: This is true a high quality product
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my engine and it looks good plus it holds up to the heat very well. I reccomend this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a great experience. Received product
customer_reviews.text: Not a great experience. Received product, but never got it to spray correctly - just sputtered or came out in a stream.
customer_reviews.author: Russetti

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gm Blue Color From Vht!
customer_reviews.text: Great Vht Gm Blue Engine Paint!! Just Like The One They Used In Detroit!
customer_reviews.author: Dan The Man, The Marshmallow Man

customer_reviews.title: Great paint.
customer_reviews.text: I've had great luck with VHT paint. I've used the roll bar paint and the high heat exhaust paint. They sprayed on easy and have both lasted. This engine paint sprayed out nicely, and I have no reason to expect anything but a long lasting finish. I would recommend VHT paint to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: 58driver

customer_reviews.title: Good coat but
customer_reviews.text: Good coat but, the cans dont last very long. I've gone through quite a few feeling as though there should normally be more in a can this size. Otherwise its really good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Color gloss really stands out use it on a lid for a ugly drum smoker, and boy does it look good.
customer_reviews.author: Wiliam Latham

customer_reviews.title: Great color adheres well
customer_reviews.text: Great color pressure only lasted 3/4 of the way left couple ounces of paint in it I didnt get to use.
customer_reviews.author: Capt.

customer_reviews.title: Very durable spray paint
customer_reviews.text: I put in tons of miles and pressure on my truck within the last 4 months and the calipers still look the same from when I painted them. I will definitely use this spray paint for my other cars!
customer_reviews.author: Rastasquatch

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I tried 2 different clears and this one worked best great product
customer_reviews.author: georgia  belmonte

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping paint seems fresh it's not old works great
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Otay

customer_reviews.title: spray can spit out glob of crap on to half finished paint job.
customer_reviews.text: most expensive paint I bought, worst performance. can spit out a glob of crap on to my paint job half way through painting. have to let dry and sand down and start over, thanks!! would give no stars but reply won't let you.
customer_reviews.author: ANGRY BOB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: used this for my calipers and matches my emblems perfect love everything i found for my truck
customer_reviews.author: jeanie

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but doesn't harden properly.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to clear coat a valve cover that I painted with VHT engine enamel. The finish is beautiful, however, when the engine heats up, this clear coat becomes very soft.
customer_reviews.author: Rektakular

customer_reviews.title: Shade is darker than it should be.
customer_reviews.text: This shade of blue is darker than the original GM Corporate Blue on the 1977 engine I was touching up. It really wasn't that close at all, so I had to purchase another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Vette

customer_reviews.title: didn't use primer and it still ended up looking fine (and holding up well
customer_reviews.text: Used this to repaint my valve covers when they were off for a valve cover gasket leak, didn't use primer and it still ended up looking fine (and holding up well.)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tried and true brand. Fast shipping.
customer_reviews.text: I do like the VHT brand. I use it to paint my calipers. It holds up fine depending on how much you drive. I've used this blue, a darker blue and the bright green they have. So obviously if you drive more often you'll obtain brake dust, salt wear, etc quicker. The brightness however holds up. I would recommended this brand. The pricing on Amazon and the actual company website are similar if not the same. I received my shipment in a day (ETA was 1-3 days). Very pleased with how quickly I received it.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: The product goes on well and has a decent shine ...
customer_reviews.text: The product goes on well and has a decent shine to it. Ive used this with VHT heat rated primer, enamel and this clear as the final coat. It has held up extremely well on my valve cover and head but has yellowed and chipped on my intake.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Bruce's paint
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, it's VHHT! Really makes the work being painted look like factory. Never disappointed with VHT spray paint.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce's Reviews A-Z

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Used it to spray stencils on an intercooler. Works well even at odd angles.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: The color is a little lighter than I had hoped ...
customer_reviews.text: The color is a little lighter than I had hoped. Its more of a light pink then a hot pink.
customer_reviews.author: Carissa

customer_reviews.title: Protects my art
customer_reviews.text: We used it to cover a mural behind our wood burning stove. Stunk like hell, you need a mask when you spray. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred L Scheps

customer_reviews.title: good paint, gas removed some of it but still
customer_reviews.text: good paint, gas removed some of it but still works
customer_reviews.author: Kurt morris

customer_reviews.title: Great match
customer_reviews.text: Used on mufflers I bought on here to cover up welds bc the mufflers were red perfect match.
customer_reviews.author: J. C.

customer_reviews.title: VHT engine enamel...Its the good stuff.
customer_reviews.text: VHT engine enamel is the right stuff. I used it before, and used it again. Painting the air cooled aluminum engine on my motorcycle...I wanted something that wouldnt flake or peel. So, I turned to VHT, I cleaned the engine thoroughly w acetone, then sprayed the VHT engine enamel primer, engine paint, engine clear coat. They all sprayed on smooth and the gloss is slick and shiny. It is a must to follow the instructions on the can...this paint must be cured properly! (it is very fragile before curing and tough after) More than two years and 2000 miles on Illinois chip & tar roads. I couldnt be happier.
customer_reviews.author: E. Koester

customer_reviews.title: Poopy
customer_reviews.text: This paint laid down awful! And is not anywhere near the color it shows!
customer_reviews.author: Dalton

customer_reviews.title: It's paint, but it's also good paint!
customer_reviews.text: This paint is light grey in color and sprays very evenly without drips. As it dries, it hardens to form a good primer base for the next coat. I used this on an aluminum pot I was making into a mini smoker. It has withstood temps of 300 degrees and didn't present any issues. Would buy this paint again.
customer_reviews.author: NC Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great color
customer_reviews.text: Loved the color. Painted my bar-b-que grill to match my travel trailer decor. Have used it several times and it hasn't faded or chipped.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do Not buy from this vender
customer_reviews.text: I bought a case of VHT engine heat paint not one can would spray just clumps of paint would come out for a hole case to be bad it must have been out of date would not buy from this vender
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I love this spray. Exactly the pink I wanted. I sprayed my calipers a few months back and have not had any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Not A Barbie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect color match for early 70's Pontiac restorations... exact match as original color from the factory
customer_reviews.author: Larry M.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Hey its pink and works awesome. Can't get pink high heat paint anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Softing

customer_reviews.title: great paint
customer_reviews.text: we purchased this high temp spray paint because we were restoring a 1950's oven that works great but had a goldtone color. paint has been on over 2 months and with many uses in the oven at all temps, this paint held up beautify
customer_reviews.author: Rick Reeder

customer_reviews.title: Not HOT pink
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not HOT pink. Pink yes but pink pink 🤦‍♂️☹️
customer_reviews.author: Travis Liller

customer_reviews.title: Defective spray nozzle - cant return.
customer_reviews.text: Defective spray nozzle spits uneven globs of paint - I am very familiar with VHT products and the can I received is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... my engine and transaxle with this and it looks great.
customer_reviews.text: Painted my engine and transaxle with this and it looks great.
customer_reviews.author: FormosaTiger

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! My husband painted my brake calipers with this ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! My husband painted my brake calipers with this paint. Although my family makes fun of me for now having pink calipers, I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Kim J

customer_reviews.title: Great color
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be more red then orange but it looks orange overall after paint. Love the color anyway and ended up leaving it alone.
customer_reviews.author: Tatted up jazz

customer_reviews.title: Great Engine Paint
customer_reviews.text: Great Engine Paint. Moving forward I will only use VHT.
customer_reviews.author: Reedt

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Product covered well, easy to use. But, color is DEFINITELY NOT hot pink, much more a bubble gum pink. Disappointed in color
customer_reviews.author: Karri

customer_reviews.title: Try on your patio set
customer_reviews.text: I used this to repaint my patio set that is in the high heat outside all summer. After sanding a little, the paint went on well and seems to be doing good out there.
customer_reviews.author: SHARON-CHICAGO

customer_reviews.title: Dull, tan paint came out
customer_reviews.text: The plastic cover was a decent match to the gold of my sailboat's recently cleaned and upgraded Universal diesel engine... then I started painting... Dull, tan paint came out. ZERO luster, TERRIBLE mis-match to the once shiny gold engine. TOO LATE it's covered now!!! :(
customer_reviews.author: dan stillman

product_meta.title: VHT SP119 Engine Enamel Chevy Orange Red Paint Can - 11 oz.
product_meta.description: Color:Chevy Orange Red| Size:Single| Style:CoatingVHT SP119 Rocket Red High Temp (500 degrees Fahrenheit) Engine Enamel has excellent durability and superior heat and chemical resistance. It is specially formulated to withstand corrosion, rust, salt spray, chemicals and additives of today's gasoline blends and degreasers. VHT's 550 degree engine enamel is a unique blend of urethane and ceramic resins, which produce a long-lasting finish for engines, engine accessories or wherever a tough durable heat and chemical resistant finish is needed. VHT SP119 is part of a multi high performance coating system for the ultimate protection and quality. The coating system consists of surface prep, strip fast, engine primer, engine color, and engine clear. VHT engine enamel dries to the touch in 30 minutes and completely over night. VHT engine enamel only attains its unique qualities after correct curing. Curing occurs with normal engine operating temperatures or parts can be heated to 200 degrees Fahrenheit. Complete application and curing process instructions are also printed on each can.
